TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WorkflowMenuCommands extends System.ComponentModel.Design.StandardCommands

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Defines a set of fields that each corresponds to a command function provided by the workflow designers. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
WorkflowMenuCommands contains a set of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID> fields that can be used to specify a command to link when adding a command using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.MenuCommandService.AddCommand%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IMenuCommandService>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.MenuCommandService>. In this example, a context menu is created when the `ShowContextMenu` is called. In the `GetSelectionMenuItems` method, the WorkflowMenuCommands class is utilized to associate the proper menu commands provided by the workflow designer with their corresponding text. When this is finished, an event handler is associated with each command so that when the command is selected, the appropriate `MenuCommand` is invoked.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#44](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#44)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#44](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#44)]
To enable this service, call the `AddService` method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.BasicDesignerLoader.LoaderHost%2A> property in a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader> class as shown in the following example.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#31](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#31)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#31](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#31)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.MenuCommandService>. In this example, a context menu is created when the `ShowContextMenu` is called. In the `GetSelectionMenuItems` method, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowMenuCommands> class is utilized to associate the proper menu commands provided by the workflow designer with their corresponding text. When this is finished, an event handler is associated with each command so that when the command is selected, the appropriate `MenuCommand` is invoked.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#44](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#44)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#44](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#44)]
To enable this service, call the `AddService` method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.BasicDesignerLoader.LoaderHost%2A> property in a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader> class as shown in the following example.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#31](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#31)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#31](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#31)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID BreakpointActionMenu

Docs.summary: Gets the for the breakpoint action menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The breakpoint action menu is typically used to set, remove, or change breakpoints.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID BreakpointConditionMenu

Docs.summary: Gets the for the breakpoint condition menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The breakpoint condition menu is typically used to set, remove, or change conditional breakpoints.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID BreakpointConstraintsMenu

Docs.summary: Gets the for the breakpoint constraints menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The breakpoint constraints menu is typically used to set, remove or change constraints on breakpoints.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID BreakpointHitCountMenu

Docs.summary: Gets the for the breakpoint hit count menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The breakpoint hit count menu typically displays the hit count for breakpoints.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID BreakpointLocationMenu

Docs.summary: Gets the for the breakpoint location menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The breakpoint location menu is typically used to modify the location of breakpoints.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID ChangeTheme

Docs.summary: Gets the for the change theme menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The theme change menu is typically used to change the theme for the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID ClearBreakpointsMenu

Docs.summary: A that can be used to access the clear breakpoints menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The clear breakpoints menu is typically used to clear all breakpoints set in the debugger.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID Collapse

Docs.summary: A that can be used to access the collapse menu. This field is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collapse menu is typically used to collapse composite activities.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.MenuCommandService>. In this example, a context menu is created when the `ShowContextMenu` is called. In the `GetSelectionMenuItems` method, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowMenuCommands> class is utilized to associate the proper menu commands provided by the workflow designer with their corresponding text. When this is finished, an event handler is associated with each command so that when the command is selected, the appropriate `MenuCommand` is invoked.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#44](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#44)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#44](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#44)]
To enable this service, call the `AddService` method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.BasicDesignerLoader.LoaderHost%2A> property in a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerLoader> class as shown in the following example.
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#31](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets.cs#31)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#31](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets.vb#31)]

## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.MenuCommandService>. In this example, a context menu is created when the `ShowContextMenu` is called. In the `GetSelectionMenuItems` method, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowMenuCommands> class is utilized to associate the proper menu commands provided by the workflow designer with their corresponding text. When this is finished, an event handler is associated with each command so that when the command is selected, the appropriate `MenuCommand` is invoked.

## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.MenuCommandService>. In this example, a context menu is created when the `ShowContextMenu` is called. In the `GetSelectionMenuItems` method, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowMenuCommands> class is utilized to associate the proper menu commands provided by the workflow designer with their corresponding text. When this is finished, an event handler is associated with each command so that when the command is selected, the appropriate `MenuCommand` is invoked.
